amendment.description: Amendment sought to require a study and a report containing recommendations regarding the advisability of authorizing a state education authority to close a school district over the opposition of a locally elected school board, and regarding best practices governing the exercise of authority by a state education agency in monitoring, supervising and controlling under-performing school districts with particular emphasis on rural and underserved school districts.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 24 printed in House Report 113-158 to create a report containing recommendations regarding the advisability of authorizing a state education authority to close a school district over the opposition of a locally elected school board, and regarding best practices governing the exercise of authority by a state education agency in monitoring, supervising and controlling under-performing school districts with particular emphasis on rural and underserved school districts.

action.text: Amendment (A024) offered by Ms. Jackson Lee.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Jackson Lee amendment (A024) Failed by recorded vote: 186 - 237 (Roll no. 371).
